data.question: What is the adsorption capacity of MFM-520 for NO2 at 298 K and 0.01 bar?
How does the presence of water affect the retention of NO2 in MFM-520?
data.answer: The presence of water only showed a small adverse effect on the retention of NO2.

data.question: Is MFM-520 stable when soaked in boiling water for one month?
What is the main advantage of using MFM-520 for NO2 capture over SCR technology?
data.answer: MFM-520 does not rely on toxic chemicals or precious-metal catalysts and is capable of complete NOx elimination.

data.question: Can MFM-520 be regenerated after NO2 adsorption?
What is the isosteric heat of adsorption (Qst) for NO2 in MFM-520?
What happens to NO2@MFM-520 when treated with water in air?
data.answer: NO2 is quantitatively converted to HNO3 and MFM-520 is fully regenerated.

data.question: Does the adsorption of NO2 in MFM-520 depend on the presence of neighboring molecules?
What is the selectivity of MFM-520 for NO2 over N2 at 298 K and 1.0 bar?
Is the adsorption of NO2 in MFM-520 reversible?
What is the effect of temperature on the uptake of NO2 by MFM-520?
data.answer: The strong adsorption is evidenced by the small effect of temperature on uptake.

data.question: Does MFM-520 maintain its crystallinity after 125 cycles of NO2 sorption-desorption?
What is the role of the bowtie-shaped pores in MFM-520?
data.answer: They precisely confine two NO2 molecules to form an unusually stable N2O4 with a short N-N bond.

data.question: Can MFM-520 adsorb NO2 from gas mixtures under flow conditions?
What is the Brunauer–Emmett–Teller (BET) surface area of desolvated MFM-520?
How does MFM-520 compare to MFM-300(Al) in terms of NO2 uptake?
data.answer: MFM-520 shows a notably higher uptake of NO2 at very low pressure compared to MFM-300(Al).

data.question: Is MFM-520 stable when exposed to nitric acid?
What is the effect of SO2 on the performance of MFM-520?
data.answer: MFM-520 achieves excellent separation of NO2 from NO2/SO2 mixtures.

data.question: Does the presence of CO2 affect the adsorption of NO2 by MFM-520?
What is the entropy of adsorption (ΔS) for NO2 in MFM-520?
data.answer: Decreases steadily with increasing loading, indicating an ordering of the captured NO2.
